sentences: Sara Pétursdóttir (born 26 March 1997), better known by her stage name Glowie, is an Icelandic singer.

section: == Career == | === 2014−2016: Career beginnings ===

sentences: In 2014, Glowie won the Singing Contest of Icelandic Junior Colleges.
section: == Career == | === 2014−2016: Career beginnings ===

sentences: 11 record labels offered her contracts, but she asked them to wait for one or two years before signing her, so that she could develop as an artist.
section: == Career == | === 2014−2016: Career beginnings ===

sentences: On 10 April 2015, she released her debut single, "No More", through StopWaitGo.
section: == Career == | === 2014−2016: Career beginnings ===

sentences: The song went on to become a hit, topping the charts in Iceland for 3 consecutive weeks.

sentences: On 29 September 2015, Glowie released "Party".

sentences: The song spent 10 weeks on the Icelandic singles chart, peaking at number 4.

section: == Career == | === 2017−present: Columbia Records and Where I Belong EP ===

sentences: In February 2017, Glowie was named as one of the hottest Icelandic artists by Vice.
section: == Career == | === 2017−present: Columbia Records and Where I Belong EP ===

sentences: In March 2017, it was announced that she had signed an international recording contract with Columbia Records and RCA Records.
section: == Career == | === 2017−present: Columbia Records and Where I Belong EP ===

sentences: On 27 October 2017, Glowie featured on iLL BLU's song "Tribalist (Get to Know)".

sentences: On 26 October 2018, Glowie released "Body", her first single on Columbia Records.

sentences: A music video for the song was filmed in Malibu and was released on 16 November 2018.
